definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
busy season/peak period/see also 淡季[dan4 ji4]
Wangcang county in Guangyuan 廣元|广元[Guang3 yuan2], Sichuan

sentences.english: As I sat there in the silence, the fire grew larger.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在這片寂靜中，爐火漸漸旺起來。

sentences.english: The little man stirred the coals again and blew on them to make them burn brighter.
sentences.chinese: 小個子又攪了攪煤渣並吹着氣讓它們燃燒得更旺一點。

sentences.english: We threw some logs on the fire, and it burned up with a crackle.
sentences.chinese: 我們加了一些木頭，火就噼噼啪啪旺了起來。

sentences.english: Nonetheless, I think Mr. Whang's book is excellent.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我覺得旺先生的書是很好。

sentences.english: You are win popular with masses.
sentences.chinese: 你人緣好人氣旺贏得衆望。

sentences.english: Flowers in the summer, Fires in the fall.
sentences.chinese: 夏季花燦爛，秋天篝火旺。

sentences.english: We wonder if Wonderly and Wontner would wait for another week.
sentences.chinese: 我們不知道旺德利和旺特納是否會再等一星期。

sentences.english: We wonder if Wonderly and Wontner would wait for another week.
sentences.chinese: 我們不知道旺德利和旺特納是否會再等一星期。

sentences.english: Father poked the fire with a poker.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸用通條把火捅得更旺。

sentences.english: For Jolie, one of the world's top box office stars, financial luck will be hers this year.
sentences.chinese: 全世界最賣座的女影星之一朱莉在兔年的財運就很旺。

sentences.english: I put the last of my birch bark on the fire and fanned it into life.
sentences.chinese: 我把最後一塊樺樹皮放進火裏，把火煽得旺了起來。

sentences.english: Dormitory first floor is business shop, this business shop can be hired also can not hire.
sentences.chinese: 宿舍一樓是旺鋪，此旺鋪可租也能夠不租。

sentences.english: But the stove was hot, and he had not thought of that.
sentences.chinese: 但是火爐燒得很旺，他並沒有想到那回事。

sentences.english: If you put on more coal, the fire will burn up.
sentences.chinese: 如果再添些煤，火就會旺起來。

sentences.english: He put some coals on the fire and made it burn up.
sentences.chinese: 他給火添了些煤塊，使水燒得更旺。

definition: Mandate of Heaven/the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC/usually written 大運河|大运河[Da4 Yun4 he2]
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
luck with the ladies/a romance/good luck
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
to add a son to the family
